intro: Urtica dioica var. pycnantha, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its hollow, green stems covered in fine, stinging hairs that release irritants upon contact. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish flowers in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Urtica dioica var. pycnantha is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and nutritional benefits.
